com.agreeya.memoir

Class ImageLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agreeya.memoir.ImageLoader

  • public class ImageLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Aalap Shah A helper class to load remote images asynchronously.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ImageLoader.ImageLoaderCallback
      This is an internal static class which represents the ImgaeLoaderCallback used if user chooses to get notified about the download.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static ImageLoader initialize(Context context)
        initializes the image loader and its internal structures.
        Parameters:
        context - - context is application's base context. Used to get the file-system access.
        Returns:
        returns the reference to the ImageLoader object used for further APIs.

      • resetPriortiy

        public void resetPriortiy()
        This API lets user reset priorities of all the older movies, basically very useful in case user switches from a screen to new screen in application. So all the requests from older screen are not immediately required anymore. Hence priorities of those can me reduced so new requests for new screen can get the bandwidth. It basically moves all of those with fastest priority to faster priority and all those with faster priority to fast priority.

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage(java.lang.String imageUrl,
             ImageView imageView,
             ImageLoader.ImageLoaderCallback ilcb,
             int loadPriority,
             int expireTime,
             java.lang.String tag,
             int scale)
        loadImage is an API to load the remote image URL into Android ImageView or get notified about the download complete of the image by ImageLoaderCallback. It lets you define the load priority of the image url. Images can be loaded with three different priorities namely fastest, faster, fast. User can choose from FASTEST_QUEUE, FASTER_QUEUE, FAST_QUEUE. It allows user to define the expire time with the image. Expire time defines for how long will that image be stored in the file-system. Tag is a string which is associated with the request. It is used for purging. You can assign tag string with every request and do a bulk purging based on the tag string. Scale is scaling factor used to reduce the image quality. It affects the image's sampling while decoding.
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - remote URL of the image to be download.
        imageView - ImageView in which the image has to be applied. if image callback is used still image view can be passed. In that case in callback the imageview would be returned back.
        ilcb - Image loader callback if user wishes to be notified about the download.
        loadPriority - image loading priority
        expireTime - time for which the image should be cached in file-system
        tag - tag string associated with the image.
        scale - scaling factor of the image. Default it should be 1 (no scaling)

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage(java.lang.String imageUrl,
             ImageView imageView,
             ImageLoader.ImageLoaderCallback ilcb,
             int loadPriority,
             int expireTime,
             java.lang.String tag)
        load Image API with fewer parameters. The task is same as the main imageLoader API
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - remote URL of the image to be download.
        imageView - ImageView in which the image has to be applied. if image callback is used still image view can be passed. In that case in callback the imageview would be returned back.
        ilcb - Image loader callback if user wishes to be notified about the download.
        loadPriority - image loading priority
        expireTime - time for which the image should be cached in file-system
        tag - tag string associated with the image.

             ImageView imageView,

             int scale)

        loadPriority - image loading priority

             int loadPriority,

      • decache

        public void decache()
        This API completely clears the internal image cache. Should be used only in emergency.

      • decacheByTag

        public void decacheByTag(java.lang.String tag)
        This API is exposed to user to do manual tag based purging. So once they have passed tags along with image requests and they choose to purge all those images associated with specific tag name can be purged.
        Parameters:
        tag - tag string to purge with.
